decks.notes: The deck focuses on using powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while deploying threats of its own. This control strategy is bolstered by the inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, allowing for various avenues to victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Life from the Loam in conjunction with various utility lands such as Wasteland and Grove of the Burnwillows to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. It also includes cards like Punishing Fire and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats while maintaining card advantage with Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while denying them resources through land destruction and maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressive Eldrazi creatures early on, utilizing mana acceleration to power them out quickly. With cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Matter Reshaper, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Chalice of the Void and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional control elements, while cards like Endbringer and Walking Ballista offer versatility and late-game power. The land base is optimized for Eldrazi tribal synergies, with cards like Ancient Tomb, Cavern of Souls, and Wasteland supporting the aggressive game plan.

This deck is focused on playing aggressively and controlling the game through efficient spells. The main idea is to disrupt opponents? plans with cards like Daze and Force of Will while applying pressure with creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck utilizes card draw and selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to find threats and answers quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color identity while also utilizing cards like Wasteland to disrupt opponents? mana base.

This deck focuses on playing low cost, efficient creatures and disrupting opponent's game plan with countermagic and land destruction. The goal is to quickly pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Tarmogoyf while using spells like Delver of Secrets and Lightning Bolt to control the board. The deck prioritizes tempo and efficiency, aiming to win the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Essentially, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, disruptive aggro strategy.

This UWx Control deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of card advantage, removal spells, and counter magic. The deck aims to outvalue its opponent by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Search for Azcanta to generate card advantage while also being able to control the board with board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict. The deck also includes a suite of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Unexpectedly Absent to deal with threats on the board, backed up by a suite of counterspells and card filtering through Predict and Brainstorm.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal to generate a large amount of storm count, allowing for powerful spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck also utilizes strong card draw and selection with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to find the pieces needed for the combo. In addition, disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress help to control the opponent's game plan while the deck goes off.

The key concept of this Legacy Aggro-Delver deck revolves around efficiently disrupting the opponent with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets. The deck aims to control the game by using counter spells and removal, while also being able to generate value with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck's mana base provides consistency and flexibility, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and scenarios.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Vryn Wingmare, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Phyrexian Revoker and Mother of Runes to control the board. Stoneforge Mystic is used to fetch powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to further increase the aggression. The deck aims to control the board through disruption while applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipment.

The key focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Daze, Spell Pierce, and Stifle to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also having removal like Lightning Bolt and Dismember for key threats. The deck also has card advantage and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure a consistent game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to win quickly.

This Grixis Aggro deck aims to disrupt and pressure opponents with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By combining threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler with cards like Daze, Stifle, and Force of Will, the deck keeps opponents on the back foot while dealing consistent damage. Efficient card draw with Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe helps maintain tempo, while versatile removal options like Lightning Bolt and Dismember provide answers to opposing threats. The mana base is streamlined to support a fast and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Gamble, and Exploration to quickly find and play key land cards such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful Marit Lage token. Additionally, the deck includes Punishing Fire for removal and Life from the Loam for card advantage and graveyard recursion. The key strategy is to lock down the opponent with lands and overwhelm them with powerful land interactions.

The deck focuses on utilizing Life from the Loam to repeatedly return lands from the graveyard and control the board with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Punishing Fire, and Abrupt Decay. It also includes a toolbox of creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to provide additional control and disruption. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing lands like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter while generating card advantage with Dark Confidant. The inclusion of Chalice of the Void helps further disrupt the opponent's spells and strategies.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to create a prison-like control over the opponent. By utilizing cards such as Ensnaring Bridge, Smokestack, and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to limit the opponent's options and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Sorcerous Spyglass and Tangle Wire further adds to the control aspect of the deck. The mana base is designed to support the artifact strategy, with cards like Metalworker and Crucible of Worlds providing additional synergy. Overall, the deck aims to lock down the opponent while slowly building up its own advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Monastery Mentor. By using these tools, the player can slow down their opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and building up their own board presence. The deck's win conditions come in the form of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, which can quickly take over the game once they hit the battlefield. This Control-Stoneblade deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.
